newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani authority orders restructuring of bourse.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani authority orders restructuring of bourse.

text.p: Pakistan's Corporate Law Authority (CLA) has told the Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) to restructure its board of directors so that at least one third of them should be non-brokers, the CLA chairman said on Thursday.
Shamim Ahmed Khan told Reuters the KSE had been asked on Wednesday to amend its rules of association by July 31 to incorporate the changes sought by the authority.

"The governing Board of the Directors of the stock exchanges should be restructured to enable induction of at least 33 percent outside non-broker members on the board, representing the interest of the public, to be nominated by the Corporate Law Authority," a CLA directive to the KSE said.
Khan said the CLA had asked the exchange to appoint a full-time professional non-broker as chief executive officer with the approval of the Corporate Law Authority.
Khan said similar instructions would soon be sent to the Lahore Stock Exchange and the Islamabad Stock Exchange.

"The CLA has initiated the process of major restructuring of the stock exchanges which should modernise the infrastructure of the market," he said. "These measures are aimed at modernising the stock exchanges and making them more transparent and responsive to the interest of the general public," Khan added.
The CLA has told the KSE to reduce the number of elected board members to 12 from 15 and add four CLA nominees.
No comment from Karachi stock exchange officials was immediately available.
